h3. Problem Definition
As of now, even though [Application Links Integration|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/APPLINKS/Link+Atlassian+applications+to+work+together] has been enabled in Confluence, should the user try to [create JIRA issue by highlighting some text in Confluence page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/confluence-5-4-release-notes-414187879.html#Confluence5.4ReleaseNotes-CreateJIRAissuesfromConfluence], the user will then still be prompted to select the JIRA _Project_. 


h3. Suggested Solution
For JIRA _Project_ to be automatically selected once the user try to create JIRA issue from Confluence, should the JIRA _Project_ has been linked to that particular Confluence Space.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a user receives an email notification from Confluence and attempts to open the link directly from their mobile device, the page does not render at all.  It also does not render when opening the link from a desktop browser. Only a blue box in the header appears. 

The URL in the email is in the following format: 

 https://<baseURL>/plugins/servlet/mobile#comment-5089764

h3. Environment

* Tested in the latest iOS 9
* Chrome
* Firefox

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page on CAC
# Watch the page
# Add a comment
# Receive the email with the link to the comment. For example: https://confluence.atlassian.com/plugins/servlet/mobile#comment-816526614
# Click the link

h3. Expected Results

You are taken to the comment.

h3. Actual Results

The page does not render. All that displays is a blue header bar and a blank page. See attached screenshot. 

h3.Workaround

'Request Desktop Site' in both mobile Safari and Chrome will allow you to view the page. Here's what you'll need to do:

*Safari*
# Access the link via email
# Once it loads in the browser, hold your finger on the reload URL icon. You should see a pop-up at the bottom 'Request Desktop Site'
# Click 'Request Desktop Site'

*Chrome*
# Access the link via email and paste into the address bar in Chrome.
# Click the three dots to the right of the address bar.
# Select 'Request Desktop Site'
fields.summary: Links from email notifications do not render in Mobile Device or Desktop browsers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41331].
  {panel}

We are using Confluence 5.9.4 
System groups like jira-users, confluence-users, stash-users  are available for all users as they are the member in these System groups.
Currently a Space admin is able to search and add these system groups (available in Confluence application) in his space. 
This is a security risk as the "Space Administrator" in Confluence can add accidentally any other system specific groups and all other members in system specific groups (who do not require the access in the space) can also get access in the space.
So the space administrators should not add system groups in their spaces and there should be admin configuration to exclude application specific groups in group search screen.
Please implement the solution as this is a security issue.
fields.summary: Confluence should have admin configuration to exclude application specific groups in group search screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41329].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The Scatter Chart Macro expects a table like the XY Line Chart that is made of a sequence of values but Scatter charts are normally made to compare 2 data sets and form (x,y) cartesian dots to graph correlation.

Here are some link about scatter graphs:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scatter_plot
http://www.excel-easy.com/examples/scatter-chart.html
https://www.mathsisfun.com/data/scatter-xy-plots.html

At the moment, the chart is expecting a table like XY Line Chart:
 
|| || 12 || 14 || 23 ||
|Revenue|41.1|31.8|12.4|
|Expense|31.1|41.8|43.6|
That graphs:
XYline:     ---------------------------------------------- Scatter:
 !xyline.jpg|thumbnail!  !scatter1.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3. Problem
If one has a data set to compare such as 
Ice Cream Sales vs Temperature: from [this link|https://www.mathsisfun.com/data/scatter-xy-plots.html]

||Temperature °C	||Ice Cream Sales||
|14.2|	215|
|16.4|	325|
|11.9|	185|
|15.2|	332|
|18.5|	406|

The Scatter chart would fail to graph it.

If doing:
|Temperature °C |14.2|16.4|11.9|15.2|18.5|
|Ice Cream Sales|	215|	325|	185|	332|	406|

This is the result:
 !icecreamsales.jpg|thumbnail! 
Which is pretty close but confirms that the first row is considered the X axis and additional rows are sequence of Y values.
The Label is missing because it is not actually considered a data set.

So it looks like scatter chart is like the XYLine Chart but without the line and so it is not a true scatter graph that graphs (x,y) tuples to compare correlation between data sets.
fields.summary: Scatter chart of the Chart Macro expects incorrect data set

h3. Problem Definition

Currently if the width of the browser is under 1240px the sidebar will overlap content (confluence but same AUI design in the Atlassian suite).

fields.description:
h3. Summary
- While using Confluence with Jira remote directory for user management, if I want to search for information regarding user usage, such as last login data, we cannot find because nothing is registered in the cwd_user_attribute for users coming from Jira remote directory. Data is saved normally in the cwd_user.

h3. Steps to reproduce
- PostgreSQL as database.
- Install Jira 6.4.x.
- Install confluence 5.8.x, 5.9.x, set Jira remote directory for User Management.
- Create a "testuser" and login
- Create any content.
- Throw the below queries, from the links, to find information regarding this user.
- [How to check for users who never logged into Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-check-for-users-who-never-logged-into-confluence-777015610.html]
- [How to list the last login date for all users in Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-list-the-last-login-date-for-all-users-in-confluence-683541075.html]
- [How to identify inactive users in Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-identify-inactive-users-in-confluence-214335880.html]
{code}select * from cwd_user
select * from cwd_user_attribute
select * from cwd_directory{code}

h3. Expected Results
- Data is retrieved from the cwd_user and cwd_user_attribute.

h3.Actual Results
- Nothing is retrieved from cwd_user_attribute about the Jira remote directory user.

h3. Investigation Done
- cwd_user receives the data normally
- when used with Jira, the cwd_user_attribute receives only data from the Confluence Internal Directory
- both cwd_user and cwd_attribute receives data normally when used with just Confluence internal and when used with LDAP/AD. Can retrieve desired data with the above queries.

h3. Workaround
- Can retrieve the desired data from the Jira database by adapting the queries. Jira uses cwd_user_attributes. Note the {{s}}. 
- Example:
{code}SELECT cwd_user.user_name, to_timestamp(CAST(cwd_user_attributes.attribute_value as double precision)/1000) AS LastLogin
FROM cwd_user_attributes, cwd_user 
WHERE cwd_user_attributes.user_id = cwd_user.id 
AND cwd_user_attributes.attribute_name = 'lastAuthenticated' 
AND cwd_user.active='1'
ORDER BY LastLogin DESC;
{code}
fields.summary: cwd_user_attribute missing data from Confluence database while using jira remote directory

There is a known issue with Confluence 5.9.x when running on MySQL 5.5 concerning indexing performance. The same way CONF-37953 was mentioned on the supported platforms documentation, we should highlight this issue as well: CONF-41030

On the contrary, there is another bug that was fixed in 5.9.5, where indexing was slow on MySQL 5.6: CONF-40544

Articles to add the above information to:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/database-setup-for-mysql-128747.html

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41317].
  {panel}

h4. Problem
Our [AJP integration documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/using-apache-with-mod_jk-173681.html] does not mention adding the {{proxyName}}, {{proxyPort}}, {{scheme}} and {{secure}} parameters, however the same way as they are required [for Apache reverse-proxy integration|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/using-apache-with-mod_proxy-173669.html], they are needed here too.

These parameters are [available for the AJP connector as well|https://tomcat.apache.org/tomcat-7.0-doc/config/ajp.html].

h4. Suggestion
Make sure to mention adding these parameters in our documentation, as missing those can lead to undesired UI behaviour and functionality loss.

Please also port the same suggestion to the related documentation for other products:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/configuring-apache-reverse-proxy-using-the-ajp-protocol-183468775.html
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/fisheye/using-ajp-with-fisheye-298976834.html (for FeCru, Jetty is the webserver, but [proxy parameters can and should be passed too|https://confluence.atlassian.com/fisheye/integrating-with-other-web-servers-298976937.html])
fields.summary: Documentation request: reverse proxy parameters for AJP connector

fields.description:
h5.Steps to Reproduce
# Setup JIRA behind a reverse proxy, with an alternative access port
#* Assume that {{http://localhost:8080/jira}} is the unproxied URL
#* Assume that {{http://localhost/jira}} is the proxied address
#* The base URL is set to the unproxied URL until after the application link is created
# Setup Confluence
# Create an application link to {{localhost:8080/jira}}
# Change JIRA's base URL to the proxied address
# In the application link configuration, change JIRA's display URL to the proxied address
#* Communication will go from Confluence to JIRA over the unproxied port, but user facing links will use the display URL for hyperlinks.
# Insert a Two Dimensional Macro Chart Macro in Confluence

h5.Expected Results
The links in the chart link to the proxied address

h5.Actual Results
The links in the chart use the application URL instead. If that port is not accessible to users, this may result in links failing, or if the DNS does not resolve.

h5.Workaround
Recreate the application link so it does not bypass the reverse proxy. This may require SSL certificates from each application to be added to the other application's trust store. [This KB article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/kb/unable-to-connect-to-ssl-services-due-to-pkix-path-building-failed-779355358.html] explains how import the SSL certificates for each application involved in the application link.
fields.summary: The Two Dimensional JIRA Chart Gadget uses the Application URL instead of the Display URL

  {panel}

h4. Problem
There are a number of articles in the documentation space that are related to heap dump generation and garbage collection logging. These articles mention how to permanently change the related setting, but not how you can alter those while the application is running.

h4. Suggestion
I have created a KB explaining how some of the related parameters can be changed runtime. Please link to this article from the related documentation: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/KB/How+to+change+JVM+arguments+at+runtime+to+avoid+application+restart].

h5. Reference/affected articles
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/generating-a-heap-dump-219024032.html
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/stashkb/how-to-generate-a-heap-dump-717062495.html
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-get-a-java-heap-dump-213523770.html
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/using-memory-dumps-to-analyze-outofmemoryerrors-227416007.html
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/enterprise/garbage-collection-gc-tuning-guide-461504616.html
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/using-garbage-collection-logs-to-analyze-jira-application-performance-227416009.html
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf53/garbage-collector-performance-issues-411109189.html
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-enable-garbage-collection-gc-logging-300813751.html
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/garbage-collector-performance-issues-200707997.html
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/enterprise/garbage-collection-gc-tuning-guide-461504616.html
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHKB/Fix+Out+of+Memory+errors (+changed+ but pending for details on default location for garbage location log since Xloggc cannot be set at runtime)
fields.summary: Documentation request: Mention runtime JVM parameter change option in related docs

{code}



*full stacktrace*



{code}

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41296].
  {panel}

_This is for Confluence Cloud (6.0.0-OD-2016.12.4)_
h3. Problem Definition
A customer is trying to set up his Confluence instance so that every new user will by default have the _Subscribe to new follower notifications_ checked as well as _Autowatch_ and all the other settings unchecked. It is currently only possible to do so by asking each user to set these settings themselves in their Confluence profile email settings.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great if an administrator could set the default values for the email settings in a Confluence user profile so that each new user will have these settings from the start (currently it is only possible to configure the recommended email updates).
fields.summary: As an administrator, I want to be able to set default values for user Email settings

When I try to edit a page, the savebar appears in the middle (actually, very near the top) of the page, see attached screenshot. It seems to be independent of page content.

Other people in my organisation do not have the same issue - my suspicion is on the fact that I am using a very new chrome version, installed yesterday (50.0.2632.0). 

I do not have the same issue on IE, same pc. Others here using chrome 49 do not have the issue.

  {panel}

On the confluence wiki, the somewhat weird scissors icon is used as favicon for each page. When I've had a page open for a while, and someone updates the page, a notification appears in the bottom right of the page suggesting I refresh the page to see the update(s). When that happens, is it possible the favicon could be updated to show that the page was updated?

In the rare cases when I have so few tabs I can see anything more than the icon (my usual use case is 35-50 tabs open in chrome, so sometimes I don’t even have 
the icons showing), I can see the (#) in the tab title, but this request is to update the icon like gmail does for unread emails (it’s buried in the gmail options somewhere):

I’ve seen other websites that do this too for things where count matters, but I can’t think of them right now. Twitter maybe?
An icon change to show there was an update without a count would be good enough since I don’t really care how many updates the page has gotten, just that it has been updated or not since I last read it.
fields.summary: Enable Confluence Favicon to show page and space change status

Unless you're watching a page with inline comments, or have been specifically @ mentioned in the comment, it's almost impossible to see the light yellow highlighting that indicates there's an inline comment on a page. 

Can you either make the highlighting much darker, so it's easier to tell if there's an inline comments?
Alternatively, and I think preferably, add a "show all inline comments" option to the tools menu? It follows a similar logic to being able to see the "resolved comments" in the tools menu. 

thanks!

fields.description:
{{com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.storage.macro.StorageMacroV2Marshaller}} has a duplicate detection in its {{writeMacroId}} method to ensure no two macros on a page have the same macro ID.

This duplicate detection uses an {{ArrayList}} to store all macro IDs already used on this page. While this is not a problem at all for few macros it does not scale well for pages with a lot of macros.
Instead of an {{ArrayList}} a {{HashSet}} or any other collection class with a fast {{contains()}} implementation should be used here.

In our case a customer had almost 600 macros on a single page (the table related macros of the 'Content Formatting Macros' plugin were used to create a *large* table) and the collision detection caused an extreme slowdown when calling {{xhtmlContent.updateMacroDefinitions()}} for this page (several minutes).

We currently work around this by injecting a {{List}} implementation backed by a {{HashSet}} into the conversion context before using {{xhtmlContent.updateMacroDefinitions()}}. This sped up the execution from several minutes to few seconds.
fields.summary: Inefficient macro ID duplicate detection in StorageMacroV2Marshaller

fields.description:
h2. Steps to reproduce:
# Install JIRA 6.4.x and Confluence 5.9.x behind Nginx
# Configure NGINX using {{X-Content-Type-Options nosniff}}
# Create application link between JIRA and Confluence
# Using Internet Explorer 10, insert a list of JIRA issues using JIRA Issue Macro into Confluence page
# Preview the list of issue
# Try to Save the page

*Expected Behaviour*
A list of issue will be added into the page after the page is saved

*Actual Behaviour*
The after inserting the macro, Save button is blurred and not responding. The JIRA Issue Macro is also not added to the page.
 !ProblemInsertinginIE10.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Not affecting:
* Adding single JIRA issue using the JIRA Issue Macro 
*  Adding JIRA Chart like Pie Chart or Two Dimensional Gadget
* When IE 11 is used
fields.summary: Cannot Insert or Edit JIRA Issue Macro in IE10 when X-Content-Type-Options nosniff is used

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When configuring NGINX proxy to add 'X-Content-Type-Options nosniff' header, IE 10,11 will not be able to display the Space Blueprint images.
(!) This problem does not happen on Chrome.
 
 \\
h3. Environment
Reproduced in 5.8.17 and 5.9.4
 
 \\
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Confluence
# Install NGINX
# Follow the steps [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-use-nginx-to-proxy-requests-for-confluence-313459790.html] to configure NGINX proxy
# add this to the configuration {{add_header X-Content-Type-Options nosniff;}} after the {{proxy_pass}}
# Restart NGINX
# Restart Confluence
# Login to Confluence in IE 10 or 11
# Open the Create dialog using the 3 dots {{...}}

\\
h3. Expected Results
Space Blueprint images should appear properly.

\\
h3. Actual Results
Space Blueprint images don't show 

\\
h3.Workaround
# Comment out this {{add_header X-Content-Type-Options nosniff;}} from the configuration file. 
# Use Chrome instead of IE
fields.summary: Space blueprint images not showing in IE10,11 when adding 'X-Content-Type-Options nosniff' header

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using the Roadmap Planner macro on a Confluence page, you cannot use pages as Bars which have a page title containing a curly or square bracket.  I tested with many other characters but so far only identified these two as problems.  Nothing is present in the logs.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a Roadmap Planner macro to a Confluence page
# Edit the macro and click on a bar to edit it
# Link or add a new page which contains a bracket in the page title
# Save the macro and save the page

h3. Expected Results
# The page with brackets in the title is saved as a linked page in the bar

h3. Actual Results
The page is not saved upon one refresh of the page.  The change is lost and nothing is in the logs.

h3.Workaround
No known workaround yet other than to refrain from using brackets in the titles of linked pages.
fields.summary: Page titles with curly or square brackets cannot be saved as bars in the Roadmap Planner macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41278].
  {panel}

*Current Mobile State*
Currently, the desktop version of Confluence uses a site-wide favicon and space logos. The mobile plugin does not use these settings, rather using an Atlasssian logo, seen in the following HTML Source header fragment:

{quote}<link rel="apple-touch-icon-precomposed" sizes="57x57" href="/wiki/s/en_GB/6437/4f3a11a8e79855052f86fe30466d81ee677d8ec4/_/download/resources/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-mobile/images/apple-touch-icon-57x57-precomposed.png" />
<link rel="apple-touch-icon-precomposed" sizes="72x72" href="/wiki/s/en_GB/6437/4f3a11a8e79855052f86fe30466d81ee677d8ec4/_/download/resources/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-mobile/images/apple-touch-icon-72x72-precomposed.png" />
<link rel="apple-touch-icon-precomposed" sizes="114x114" href="/wiki/s/en_GB/6437/4f3a11a8e79855052f86fe30466d81ee677d8ec4/_/download/resources/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-mobile/images/apple-touch-icon-114x114-precomposed.png" />
<link rel="apple-touch-icon-precomposed" sizes="144x144" href="/wiki/s/en_GB/6437/4f3a11a8e79855052f86fe30466d81ee677d8ec4/_/download/resources/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-mobile/images/apple-touch-icon-144x144-precomposed.png" />{quote}

*Issue*
When deploying an iOS Web Clip to iPads, an icon is supplied in the MDM payload. The icon was created to represent the space which it links to, and more than one Web Clip is deployed.

Once opened in Safari, by default in Mobile mode, the icon will be replaced on the home screen by the Atlasssian icon specified with "apple-touch-icon-precomposed".

*Expected Behavior*
The space logo, which is also square in proportion, should be used as the precomposed icon. A space administrator should set the space icon to represent the same image that is supplied in the MDM web clip payload, so that when the web clip is opened, the icon does not change. This allows multiple web clips to be supplied to users' iDevices pointing to different spaces.
fields.summary: Use Space Logo as Mobile "apple-touch-icon-precomposed"

h3. Notes

If you want to check only the affected users first, you can use this:
{code:sql}
select distinct um.username as "creator" from content c join user_mapping um on c.creator = um.user_key where c.contenttype = 'DRAFT' and c.draftspacekey not in (SELECT spacekey FROM SPACES) order by um.username;
{code}


h3.Workaround
# Find all drafts connected to non-existing spaces in the database:
{code:sql}
select c.contentid, c.title, c.draftspacekey, um.username as "creator" from content c join user_mapping um on c.creator = um.user_key where c.contenttype = 'DRAFT' and c.draftspacekey not in (SELECT spacekey FROM SPACES) order by c.creator;
{code}
# For every response, log in as the 'creator' and access this (won't work if you log in as any user other than the creator):
{noformat}
https://instance.atlassian.net/wiki/json/deletedraft.action?draftId=<draft_id>&atl_token=#form_xsrfToken()
{noformat}
#* Replace the '<draft_id>' for the 'contentid'.
# If it works, that line should no longer appear in the select above and this should be shown in the page:
{noformat}
{}
{noformat}
fields.summary: Stack Trace Generated When Trying to View Drafts linked to a non existent Space

fields.description:
In troubleshooting, we discovered that on an instance in the wild, pages that had hundreds of comments on them performed substantially worse than other pages with similar page weight, but less comments in a proportion that far outstrips the additional weight that the comments might add in simple page volume.

We found that in this environment, pages without comments, the domContentLoaded event was being thrown 1.5-2.4 s in, whereas a page with large numbers of comments could take 8-10 seconds.

When creating a blank page in a controlled environment, I added 1k commentors and tried to access this page with a non-superuser.

Regardless whether the comments were all made by a single user, or 1k different users, I was not able to get an appreciable difference with regard to the speed, nor did I feel that the performance penalty was outsized considering the added page weight.

The customer in question where this strange phenomonon can be seen does have a very nested architecture (based on ldap nests + crowd) so it is possible that there is an interaction in the customer system that would not appear in a testing server.
fields.summary: Large numbers of comments added to a page seems to add outsized weight

fields.description:
h3. Summary

[Configuring the Allowlist|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/configuring-the-allowlist-381255821.html] mentions that enabling incoming on the allowlist configuration will enable CORS:
{quote}Allow Incoming enables CORS requests from the specified origin
{quote}
However, we've found that this, in fact, does not add the necessary _Access-Control-Allow-Origin_ header.
h3. How to check for Access-Control-Allow-Origin header

You can check for the _Access-Control-Allow-Origin_ header value by running the following CURL command against your Confluence instance:
{code}
curl -L -k -H "Origin: https://www.my-origin-url.com" -u admin:admin-pword -v https://<confluence-base-url>/rest/api/user\?username\=admin -D ~/Downloads/headers.txt
{code}
h3. How to enable CORS for a specific URL:
# Stop Confluence
# Open {{<confluence-install>/confluence/WEB-INF/web.xml}} for editing
 ** (i) NOTE: when adding this CORS filter to the web.xml file, ensure it is the first filter listed in web.xml
# Paste the following, updating the *{{cors.allowed.headers}}* <param-value> to a comma-separated list of URLs that need access to Confluence. For more information on enabling CORS in Atlassian applications, please refer to [Apache Tomcat 9 Configuration Reference (9.0.39) - Container Provided Filters|https://tomcat.apache.org/tomcat-9.0-doc/config/filter.html#CORS_Filter]
{code:java}
<!-- ==================== CORS configuration ====================== -->
<filter>
  <filter-name>CorsFilter</filter-name>
  <filter-class >org.apache.catalina.filters.CorsFilter</filter-class >
  <init-param>
    <param-name>cors.allowed.origins</param-name>
    <param-value>https://example.url.com, https://identiy-provider-domain-url</param-value>
  </init-param>
  <init-param>
    <param-name>cors.allowed.methods</param-name>
    <param-value>GET,POST,PUT,DELETE</param-value>
  </init-param>
  <init-param>
    <param-name>cors.exposed.headers</param-name>
    <param-value>Access-Control-Allow-Origin,Access-Control-Allow-Credentials</param-value>
  </init-param>
  <init-param>
    <param-name>cors.support.credentials</param-name>
    <param-value>true</param-value>
  </init-param>
</filter>
<filter-mapping>
  <filter-name>CorsFilter</filter-name>
  <url-pattern>/*</url-pattern>
</filter-mapping>
{code}
#* If using *Apache as a reverse proxy*, add the following to the <Location> or <VirtualHost> configured for Confluence (reference: [CORS on Apache|https://enable-cors.org/server_apache.html]):
{code:java}
Header set Access-Control-Allow-Origin "example.url.com"
{code}
#* For *IIS 7,* merge this into the web.config file at the root of your application/site:
{code:java}
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
  <configuration>
    <system.webServer>
      <httpProtocol>
        <customHeaders>
          <add name="Access-Control-Allow-Origin" value="example.url.com" />
        </customHeaders>
      </httpProtocol>
    </system.webServer>
  </configuration>
{code}
#* If using other proxies, check [CORS_ENABLED|https://www.w3.org/wiki/CORS_Enabled#At_the_HTTP_Server_level...] for examples such as Nginx and IIS6
 ** Remember to add your SAML provider to the comma-separated list of URLs in the CORS filter
# Save web.xml
# Start Confluence
fields.summary: Improve documentation on configuring CORS in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Hazelcast 5801 port traffic between the nodes is much larger (about 50~200 times) in Confluence Data Center 5.9.x when browsing a page containing JIRA Issue Macro, comparing to Confluence 5.7.5. The more access the cluster gets, the more traffic is generated between the nodes.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Confluence Data Center 5.9.5 cluster including 2 nodes
# Install JIRA Software 7.0.5
# Generate an Application Link between the JIRA and the CDC
# Create a page with JIRA Issue Macro in Confluence
# Access to the page by using jMeter or so forth (I used jMeter with 10 parallel threads and infinite loop count)
# Measure the traffic between the nodes by dstat command (specifically "dstat -n -N <interface>" command)
# You'll find the traffic is much larger (In my case, the traffic was about 50Mbps):
-- much larger than the case when accessing a page without JIRA Issue Macro (In my case, the traffic was about 250Kbps)
-- much larger than the case when accessing the same page in Confluence Data Center 5.7.5, which is the version that the customer is currently using (In my case, the traffic was about 250Kbps)
# As a result, CPU usage is also increased, though the CPU % does not grow disastrously severe

(i) I confirmed the traffic was hazelcast 5801 port, by creating a separate network interface only for the hazelcast traffic. Another network interface is used for all other traffics such as HTTP, PostgreSQL, NFS.

h3. Expected Results
The traffic is as high as it used to be in Confluence Data Center 5.7.5

h3. Actual Results
The traffic is about 40~200 times higher than it used to be in Confluence Data Center 5.7.5

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround found at the moment.
fields.summary: JIRA Issue Macro sends much higher hazelcast traffic between the Data Center nodes

We still need the ability to add custom fields to be displayed when in Confluence we add a link to a JIRA issue. Right now, when we add a JIRA issue link, we cannot add any fields that might be vital for us to display (aside from the issue title and current status, which get displayed by default).

In these other JIRA tickets, users have been asking for the same thing, but those issues are marked as "resolved" without an actual resolution. Several are marked as duplicates, and the one that is marked as "fixed" did not result in an actual fix:

* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-27554
* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-27033
* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-22575 <-- The one marked as "fixed" but is not actually fixed
fields.summary: Add ability to add custom fields to inline JIRA links.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Calendar macro is displaying the first day of the week as Sunday when German localisation is set.

h3. Environment
Confluence 5.9.6, 5.9.7
(!) The bug is not reproducible in 5.8

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open Confluence Login page
# Change the language to Deutsch
# Login and Edit a page
# Insert a Calendar macro or use the shortcut {{//}}


h3. Expected Results
The first day of the week should be Monday


h3. Actual Results
The first day of the week is shown as Sunday


!ss.png|thumbnail!


h3.Workaround
# Browse to {{<confluence_install>/confluence/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins}} directory
# Backup the jar file {{confluence-language-pack-de_DE-6.0.0-OD-2015.50.0-0611-2015-12-04.jar}}
# Open the original jar file, open the file {{i18n/aui_de_DE.properties}}
# Modify the value of the attribute {{ajs.datepicker.localisations.first-day}} and set it to 1
# Save the file and update the jar
# Restart Confluence
fields.summary: Wrong first day of the week in Calendar with German localisation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41236].
  {panel}

h4. Pain Point:
Today, if you bookmark a confluence page, it saves the confluence page based on the name of the page title, such as "Dummy+test+page".

However, if someone changes the title of the page, the bookmark link is basically broken.  If you bookmarked it, or sent that link to someone else via email, you can't find it directly.  Confluence fortunately has a way to ask you if you really were looking for this other page, but I think that's an unnecessary step.

h4. Proposed Solution
Since you already keep a permanent unique link for each confluence page regardless of the page title (that's revealed via Control + k), why not just use that as the browser url instead of the one based on the page title?
fields.summary: Show Permanent Confluence Page link in browser URL not the subject of the confluence page

Current Behaviour:
When attaching files, the file will be render. 
 !Thumbnail.png|thumbnail! 

Desired Option:
Administrator to be able to configure the global behaviour when attachment is added. Eg: when user add attachment, it will be automatically added as link. At the current version, user need to configure this for each attachment.
 !ShowAsLink.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Option to automatically add attachment as link
Anchor names with a full stop and other special characters in get removed from the content

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41228].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
- There are 3 cases here in the same field (Attachments label filter) of the Attachments Macro.

h2. Steps to Reproduce Case 1
# Create a space/page
# Attach some files
# Add a label to each file
# Edit the page and include the attachments macro
# While editing the macro, in the "Attachment labels", add a more than one label, following the macro description: "A comma-separated list of labels to filter by"
# Save it

h3. Expected Results
- Shows all attachments that have such labels

h3. Actual Results
- Nothing is shown

h2. Steps to Reproduce Case 2
- Same as Case 1 except for:
## Instead of adding a single label to an attachment, add the same labels you have added in the "Attachment labels" filter as a label to the attachment.
## An attachment has two or more labels

h3. Expected Results
- Shows all attachments that have such labels

h3. Actual Results
- Shows only the attachment that has all the labels

h2. Steps to Reproduce Case 3
- Same as Case 1 and 2 except for:
## Add more than one attachments macro in the page.
## Filter a single label
## Save it

h3. Expected Results
- Shows all attachments that have such labels

h3. Actual Results
- Every attachments macro that is filtered by a single label will show every attachment that has such label, including attachments that have more than one label. 

h3. Workarounds to show specific attachments
# Add the same label to every attachment you want to be shown with the macro as it work normally with one label as a filter.
# Add more than one label to an attachment(s) and filter by the same labels in the macro.

h3. Workarounds to show all attachments
# Add the same label to every attachment you want to be shown with the macro as it work normally with one label as a filter.
# Do not filter it
fields.summary: Attachment Macro - Filter by multiple labels not working

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41227].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When using a Live Search Macro as an Unlicensed Access user (Service Desk Customer), the user is able to search content by selecting it from the search suggestions but when the user hits 'return' to run the search, he is redirected to /dosearchsite.action and sees "Not Permitted" 

h3. Environment
* Confluence Space shared through JIRA Service Desk

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Link a JIRA Service Desk project to a Space
# Create a page on that space with a live search macro
# login as a Service Desk customer (user without Confluence or JIRA Application access)
# navigate to the page with the live search macro
# type on the box to see results. results can be selected and are available
# hit "Enter" on the keyboard

h3. Expected Results
Search results are shown.

h3. Actual Results
"Not Permitted" page is shown.

h3. Notes
* "Enter" redirects to /dosearchsite.action that is not accessible to "Unlicensed Access" users.
* Making the space public doesn't solve the problem.

h3.Workaround
Click on results given by the live search.
fields.summary: Livesearch macro returns Not Permitted when Unlicensed Access searching

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41226].
  {panel}

h5. Summary

When using the Files Macro to insert [^Timeline chart.xlsx], the preview generated is incorrect. The File Macro display the spreadsheet based on the page size set in the excel file. As an example, if the page size is set to A4, the File Macro will split the content to next page if the content exceeds the A4 page size. 
h5. Steps to Reproduce
 # Download and attach [^Timeline chart.xlsx] to a page in Confluence
 # Save the Page

h5. Expected Results:

The table should look similar to how it does in Excel:
 !InExcel.png|thumbnail!
h5. Actual Results

After the graph, further content is not shown:

!FilePreviewThumbnail.png|thumbnail!
 !FilePreviewFullSize.png|thumbnail!
h5. Workaround

Some spreadsheets render more fully if viewed from the View link on the list of attachments:
 To get to the attachment list:
 # Go to the page with the attachments and click the three dots next to Watch at the top right.
 # From the pulldown, choose attachments.
 # There is a blue link for "view" next to the spreadsheet.
fields.summary: The Files Preview does not preview some excel files fully

fields.description:
h5.Summary
When using the Office Macro to insert [this spreadsheet|^Timeline chart.xlsx], the preview is incorrectly.

h5.Steps to reproduce

# Delete the File Macro, and insert an "Office Excel" Macro
# Save the page

h5.Expected Results
The table should look similar to how it does in excel:

h5.Actual Results
The graph is placed lower than it actually is in the spreadsheet

h5.Testing Notes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41221].
  {panel}

We have trouble browsing the files, we have trouble viewing images.

What is done:
As the file link opens each image raw we have to click on right-click each image and open in new window. then users toggle through the tabs in browser to see the different screens.

And almost everyone misses the Preview button because it is hidden and visible only on click of the chevron near the image name.

It will be simpler if the image link opens the file in lightbox and not the raw file. And the raw file open can be in the place of preview place. See attached screen-shot.

The simpler experience would be when a user clicks on a File name it should open in lightbox.
fields.summary: File link should open in Lightbox instead of opening raw file
